content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy to understand, and good training to string manipulation. Very good.
Maybe one more example could make it more easily understable.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think it would be a good string test for some newbies to coding

Stub generator
* Please use the same variable names as in the other sections.

Constraints section
* Suggest to change "one word" to "two words" (otherwise, (a) there is the issue of whether the singular/plural form of "word" should be used in the output, and (b) additional cases should be added to cover the situation of partialQuote consisting of 1 word only).

* Suggest to mention that [[quote]] never starts with a space character.

Cases
* In Test 2, Validator 2 and Test 4, please replace â€™ (non-ASCII character) with '.

* Suggest to add cases where there are "words" which are numbers or start with a digit.

* I want to suggest to add cases where there are "words" which are hyphenated or start with a quotation mark or end with ?/!, but alas, there are too few/no such quotes in your source of quotes ðŸ˜›

Thanks.

Thanks... perfect advice as always
(Fixed now, I believe )
Please always write a reason when you approve or reject a contribution. Thanks.

Nope ðŸ˜› because...

(a) Test 2 and Test 4 still contain the non-ASCII character â€™.

(b) Test 2 contains a hyphenated word, and that contradicts the newly added constraint.

Actually, why would you *not* want to have numbers or hyphenated words in the quotes?

Right... that's what I get for "speed reading" -- I'm a silly girl !
Thanks for your eagle-eyes
~~~~~~~~
re: (a) Test 2 and Test 4 still contain the non-ASCII character â€™.
Done

re: (b) Test 2 contains a hyphenated word, and that contradicts the newly added constraint.
I re-worded the constraint 

re: Actually, why would you *not* want to have numbers or hyphenated words in the quotes?
Good point.  I only have one quote that has a number, so I added that as Test/Validator 6

No worries! I'll catch as many issues as I am able to find!

Goal section
* Please do not format the single word "quote" as a variable. Alternatively, please change it to [[fullQuote]].

Constraints section
* Please move the last constraint to the notes in Goal section.

Cases
* Would it be possible to add a *validator* where both the input and the output contains a hyphenated word?

* Validator 6 does not serve its intended purpose because the number the quote contains is outside the range of output.

Thanks.

Thanks :)

Done, done, and I adjusted Test/Validators 2 and 6 and 7.

How is it now ??
